Thomas Howell, Patrick Read Johnson', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, AC-3, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 17 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 1, 2016', 'Actors': 'Kelsey Sanders, Fred Thompson, Ernest Borgnine, Louise Fletcher, Jerry Zandstra', 'Studio': 'Entertainment One', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: This is a sleeper that would enlighten all who watch. Time well spent with family...especially teens. An every family must have.
Review Title: Amazing facts you must know
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Rick Steves The Holy Land: Director's Cut DVD
Review Date: 2016/09/08
Store: Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Experience the Holy Land with Rick Steves.', 'In this hour-long special, Rick Steves weaves together both the Israeli and the Palestinian narratives to better understand a place that is, for a third of humanity, literally holy land. The crossroads for three great religions, the Holy Land has been coveted and fought over for centuries. Dining with both Jews and Muslims, we realize the menu is essentially the same, whether in Hebrew or Arabic. While visiting the big sights, we delve deeper to better understand and empathize with both peoples. In Israel, we go from the venerable ramparts of Jerusalem to the vibrant modern skyline of Tel Aviv. In Palestine, by harvesting olives near Hebron, visiting a home in Bethlehem, and popping into a university in Ramallah, we get to know a land few tourists visit. And all along the way, we learn about security walls, disputed settlements, and the persistent challenges facing the region as Israelis and Palestinians learn to live together.', "Director's Cut DVD", "This special director's cut features an extended version of the original 1-hour public television special—plus a commentary track featuring Rick Steves and director Simon Griffith.", 'Bonus Features', 'Q&A with Rick StevesExtended interviewsBonus Disc:', "Rick Steves' Iran", 'Review', 'What public television viewers are saying about the', 'Rick Steves The Holy Land', 'special:', '"I was entranced the whole hour." –Anne, OETA viewer"[', 'The Holy Land', '] was excellent. Thank you for showing so many aspects of the people and the problems they are facing."– Mary Anne, WTTW viewer"', 'The Holy Land', 'is one of the fairest and insightful looks at modern Palestine and Israel I have ever seen." –Chris, KCTS viewer"Impressive ability to remain factual and nonjudgmental. Everyone who cares about peace in this region needs to see', 'The Holy Land', '." –Carolyn, KLRU viewer"It was just really captivating. My whole family watched it and we all loved it. It was so interesting to see how life is there without the filters of the corporate media. I can really say I learned quite a bit from watching that show." –Brian, KET viewer"Thank you, Rick, for your balanced presentation." –Matt, OPB viewer"Excellent! Thanks for showing both sides of the issue." –Anita, GPB viewer"', 'The Holy Land', 'was awesome and well done. Thank you!" –Doug, WFYI viewer"What a wonderful experience! We learned so much." –Marylou, WCNY viewer"I have learned more about Israel and Palestine than I ever have with anyone else! Fabulous and so balanced." –Barbara, NPT viewer"Thanks, Rick, for an unbiased, remarkable, well-written Holy Land special. Truly unique and engaging." –Beca, KBYU viewer']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '0.4 x 5.6 x 7.4 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'Special Edition, NTSC', 'Release date': 'April 26, 2016', 'Studio': 'Rick Steves', 'Number of discs': '1'}

raw_response:
POSITIVE SUMMARY:  
The user's purchase history reflects a strong appreciation for family-centric and informative content, emphasizing titles that offer quality viewing experiences. There is a notable enthusiasm for content that engages both parents and children, with many ratings of five stars, suggesting satisfaction and enjoyment. Positive feedback includes mentions of collective family experiences and enlightening storytelling that are both captivating and educational. The buyer values well-presented information, especially concerning significant global narratives, as indicated by the high ratings and encouraging comments on select documentaries.

NEGATIVE SUMMARY:  
The user has expressed displeasure regarding certain content aspects, particularly comments about excessive opinions or inappropriate language. They noted dissatisfaction with specific documentaries having too many interviews and rated one product very low due to the vast number of profanities. This suggests a preference for concise, focused presentations without distracting elements, particularly for content intended for varied audience age groups. There seems to be a desire for more straightforward storytelling and fewer embellishments or superfluous commentary.

OVERALL SUMMARY:  
The user's purchase history showcases a blend of positive and negative experiences while navigating different media types. While they gravitate towards engaging and enriching content, especially for family use, there is also evidence of frustration with certain stylistic choices or excessive language in some titles. Despite these setbacks, the majority of their ratings are high, indicating a pattern of seeking out meaningful, family-friendly media that provides both entertainment and educational value. The overall trend suggests a discerning viewer who appreciates quality storytelling and balanced perspectives but is sensitive to content that does not align with their values.
